alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued June 11 at 2:21PM MDT until June 15 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow possible for elevations above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches from 5000 feet to 6000 feet, between 6 and 15 inches from 6000 feet to 7000 feet, and up to 21 inches possible above 7000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, especially Tuesday afternoon and evening. * WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front above 5000 feet. * WHEN...From Monday evening through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult over Marias Pass and other routes within or adjacent to Glacier National Park. Cold and raw conditions are likely for those working and recreating outdoors.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
